question.title: Map a composite type attribute directly and use it in a JoinColumn in hibernate
question.body:
I have an entity that has a composite type for one of its column:

create type cust_type as (foo varchar, bar varchar);

create table my_table (attr cust_type, ...);

@Struct(name = "cust_type", attributes = {"foo", "bar"})
Class CustType {
  String foo;
  String bar;
}

Class MyTable {
  CustType attr;
}

That above, works.

Now I'd like to do two things: the first one is map directly attr.foo in my class :

Class MyTable {
  @Column(name = "attr.foo") <-- doesn't work
  String foo;
}

The second is use foo in a JoinColumn:

Class MyTable {
  ...

  @ManyToOne
  @JoinColumn(
    name = "attr.foo", <-- Doesn't work either
    referencedColumnName = "foo_in_my_other_entity"
  )
  OtherEntity aaa;
}

I suspect both could be solved the same way by using the correct syntax, but I can't find it.

question_comments.body: You cannot use attr.foo in Column or JoinColumn, because foo is not a real column in the table, itâ€™s just a field inside a composite type.
